WHY #ALTSEASON  IS NOT STARTING YET  There is simply no money flowing into the Altcoins market right now and almost nobody is talking about it.  This indicator tracks stablecoins issuance and capital inflows into crypto: - When the bars are green and expanding, it means new money is being created and entering the market. That‚Äôs when $BTC   and #Altcoins  tend to explode. - When the bars turn red, it means liquidity is leaving the market.  In 2022, this indicator collapsed and so did Bitcoin and Altcoins.  Unfortunately, for  weeks, even months, the amount of new money being printed and entering crypto has been shrinking.  That means: - Less institutional demand - Fewer whales allocating capital - And very little real demand for Altcoins  This does not mean there will be no Altseason. It means that right now, institutions and big players are not interested in allocating capital to Altcoins. And without fresh liquidity, rallies struggle to sustain. $SOL Validators Urged to Upgrade to Agave v3.0.14 for Stability ‚öôÔ∏è

The Solana Foundation has recommended all Mainnet-Beta validators upgrade immediately to Agave v3.0.14, a release focused on critical stability fixes. The update addresses vote-storage handling and duplicate shreds in the gossip protocol, helping improve block propagation during periods of heavy network load.

Released by Anza, the upgrade currently requires building from source and has already seen early adoption from top validators, representing roughly 2.5% of active stake. Importantly, regular users across trading, DeFi, and NFTs are unaffected, as the network remains fully operational.

Another example of Solana‚Äôs fast-response approach to maintaining high-throughput infrastructure.
